background: Originally settled by Polynesian emigrants from surrounding island groups, the Tokelau Islands were made a British protectorate in 1889. They were transferred to New Zealand administration in 1925. Referenda held in 2006 and 2007 to change the status of the islands from that of a New Zealand territory to one of free association with New Zealand did not meet the needed threshold for approval.

geography.areaCompare: about 17 times the size of The Mall in Washington, DC
geography.climate: tropical; moderated by trade winds (April to November)

environment.currIssues: limited natural resources and overcrowding are contributing to emigration to New Zealand

geography.location: Oceania, group of three atolls in the South Pacific Ocean, about one-half of the way from Hawaii to New Zealand
geography.notes: consists of three atolls (Atafu, Fakaofo, Nukunonu), each with a lagoon surrounded by a number of reef-bound islets of varying length and rising to over 3 m above sea level
geography.terrain: low-lying coral atolls enclosing large lagoons
